reg:regulation.reg:title: Conflict of Interest Exceptions (City of Vancouver) Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: entity means any of the following:
extraprovincial society has the same meaning as in the Society Act;
representative means a member of the Council appointed by the Council to the board of an entity;
society has the same meaning as in the Society Act;
specified interest means any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an expenditure of public funds to or on behalf of an entity;
an advantage, benefit, grant or other form of assistance to or on behalf of an entity;
an agreement respecting a matter described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c).

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 145.6 (1) (e) [exceptions from conflict restrictions] of the Act, a pecuniary interest in relation to a representative in the nature of a specified interest that arises as a result of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the representative being appointed by the Council to the board of the entity, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: attending any part of a meeting during which the specified interest is under consideration by the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: any other body referred to in section 165.7Â [application to other city bodies] of the Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: participating in any discussion of the specified interest at such a meeting, or
voting on a question in respect of the specified interest at such a meeting

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Vancouver Charter, S.B.C. 1953, c. 55, section 145.6 (1) (e)]
